DOC.brief_summary: This French multicentre open-label randomized trial will test the hypothesis that a coordinated health circuit based on obstetric risks, backed up by an electronic patient care reporting information system will optimize the continuum of pregnancy care monitoring. The electronic patient care reporting information system will be shared between patients, private practice physicians/midwifes, hospital physicians/midwifes and supervised by a coordinating midwife.
DOC.brief_title: Program of Research for the Optimization of a Supervised Patient Pathway for Expectant According to Risk in Obstetrics
DOC.criteria: patients over the age of majority, enrolled in one of the two maternity hospitals in the study before 12 weeks of amenorrhea (SA) and 6 days (j) of age, affiliated to the National Health Insurance Fund of the country within the regional level health insurance have an internet access illiterate patients, nonFrench speakers, under the age of majority, refusing to participate, without internet access, followed by one of these maternity wards but delivering else where, whose pregnancy ended in a miscarriage early or late (before 21 weeks of amenorrhea (SA) and 6 days (J) over).
